author: NFT-DAO (the whole team)
title: NFT-DAO EZ-Name
description: Machine-readable IDs like Cardano addresses, other cryptocurrency addresses, content hashes, and metadata are not human centered design.

assessments.note: This is a nice idea. However by design, it is focused on end users. Developers need machine readable names. Thus not clear how it addresses the challenge.
assessments.reply: Assessor asserts an opinion that their understanding of what developers need is the world view.  This is not an unbiased assessment as no evidence is presented they know what developers need.  If this was true, the whole internet naming system is not anything a developer benefits from or prefers.  The argument is weak and unfounded.  Please remove this mark as biased.

assessments.note: Think of it as DNS for Cardano addresses. Its easy to underestimate what a game changer this could be. Someday human readable addresses will be the norm. The project aims to help developers integrate this functionality into their Dapps, and will also provide a new role for stake pool operators.
assessments.reply: Yes, thank you for recognizing how we intend to expand the role of Stake Pool Operators!  And the value of human readable names.

assessments.note: The description of the problem and solution is objective and clear. The proposal is within the scope of the challenge. The use of human readable addressess facilitates the integration of users and developers and allows developers to substitute Cardano addresses without rewriting / publishing their code. The established goals indicate the potential for positive impact. I recommend including KPIs so that the potential for impact is more measurable and objective.

There is a need for human-friendly Cardano addresses. There are multiple ways to address compromise in one or more characteristics. However, the feature will be useful in some settings which can accept these compromises.

The team behind this proposal is working on the NFT-DAO, however its not clear how NFT experience makes them DID/naming service experts and the schedule, timeline and budget are super vague. There is also no technical documentation included.
assessments.reply: This comment is from the same #60 assessor who I wrote a thesis about above. The schedule is outlined and says: General Availability (GA) is approximately 8-weeks from start date. Fully Operational (FO) is approximately 6-months from start date. The budget is ~$59K which is broken down into 6 Phases which could be approximated as $10K a month very easily.  However, since it is an 8-week sprint to get the majority up and running, one can assume most of the budget is spent in the first two months which is about the burn rate of the MuKn contractors who will build the system.  Please note we chose this route because blockchain interoperability is a huge factor in the success of this product to reach the "ocean" of open source developers that handshake.org airdropped a large quanity of their token to.  Seems we had similar NFT-DAO bias from a #60 in the Fund4 proposals as well, not sure if those #60 change ID from Fund to Fund, but worth looking back on that to determine if bias is real.

assessments.note: All the NFT-DAO related projects are high class. The team behind this one appear highly qualified, and they have all the resources of NFT-DAO behind them. Similar Catalyst proposals have merged with this one, bringing even more talent ant momentum. The project intends to move forward with or without Catalyst funding.

There are details on the qualification and experience of the members who will participate in the proposal and the information described indicates the aptitude to implement the proposal successfully.

There is a very well structured and detailed plan. Although there is information that the resources will be used for contract development, marketing and operational estimates for a six-month launch cycle, there are no details on the allocation of resources, which makes it difficult to assess the feasibility of using the resources. I recommend that the allocation of resources be detailed.
The proposal is by a team with which is developing Glow programming language. The team has substantial experience and expertise to cater complete the proposal sucessfully.

This is feasible. It is not clear that it meets the challenge. It is prooviding something for end users. Yes it will also provide what devs need to make that product for end users, but that seems a little circuitous in terms of meeting the challenge.
assessments.reply: Reiteration of above from #11.  Assessor asserts an opinion that their understanding of what developers need is the world view. This is not an unbiased assessment as no evidence is presented they know what developers need. If this was true, the whole internet naming system is not anything a developer benefits from or prefers. The argument is weak and unfounded. Please remove this mark as biased.

assessments.note: This is a large proposal at 60k. As with many NFT-DAO related projects, the specific direction of these funds are not detailed. However, there is a detailed road map for the project and defined success reporting and 3, 6 and 12 months. A fully operational product is expected within 6 months.
assessments.reply: We will work on being clearer in future proposals, this one states: The budget is ~$59K which is broken down into 6 Phases which could be approximated as $10K a month very easily. However, since it is an 8-week sprint to get the majority up and running, one can assume most of the budget is spent in the first two months which is about the burn rate of the MuKn contractors who will build the system.

assessments.note: There is clarity on how the problem will be addressed and on the alignment of the proposal with this challenge. There are details about the team, a solid and detailed plan, including a clear timeline, relevant delivables and goals. I recommend including KPIs and details on budget allocation.

The project has a clear and simple aim with a high technical challenge. The scope, outline, and task list are fairly clear; therefore, it is fairly straightforward to monitor and audit the project's progress.

solution: Improve user experience by mapping human-readable names like 'alice.ada' to machine-readable identifiers such as Cardano addresses.
experience: **MuKn.io**/Glow brings skills of cybersecurity, cryptography, distributed systems, systems programming, economic modeling & mechanism design.
